question: Who is serving as the Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) to the Government of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• V. Anant Nageswaran was appointed as the Chief Economic Adviser on 28th January 2022

• His tenure has been extended till March 2027 by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet

• The CEA advises the government on economic policy, and drafts the Economic Survey presented before the Union Budget

• The CEA’s office functions under the Ministry of Finance, Government of India

• The position was first held by Dr. John Matthai in 1946, prior to independence

question: Who is serving as the National Security Advisor (NSA) of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• Ajit Doval was reappointed as National Security Advisor for a third consecutive term on 10th June 2024

• He is the longest-serving NSA in Indian history, having first assumed office on 30th May 2014

• NSA is a key advisory role under the Prime Minister’s Office, responsible for national security strategy, intelligence coordination, and strategic policy formulation

• The position was first held by Brajesh Mishra in 1998

• Ajit Doval holds the rank of Cabinet Minister, approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet

• The NSA heads the National Security Council Secretariat (NSCS) and chairs the Strategic Policy Group (SPG)

question: Who is serving as the Director General of the National Investigation Agency (NIA) as of July 2025?

• He succeeded Dinkar Gupta, whose tenure ended on 31st March 2024

• NIA is a central counter-terrorism agency, established under the NIA Act, 2008, and functions under the Ministry of Home Affairs

question: Who is serving as the Director of the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) as of July 2025?

• He succeeded Subodh Kumar Jaiswal, whose tenure ended in May 2023

• The CBI is a premier investigative agency under the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions, headquartered in New Delhi

• It was established in 1963, and its mandate includes anti-corruption, economic offenses, and special crimes

question: Who is serving as the Director of the Intelligence Bureau (IB) of India as of July 2025?
solution:

• His tenure was extended twice, most recently in May 2025, allowing him to continue till June 2026

• IB is a central intelligence agency under the Ministry of Home Affairs, headquartered in New Delhi

• It was formally named the Intelligence Bureau in 1920, tracing its origins to the Central Special Branch established in 1887

question: Who is serving as the Chief of the Research and Analysis Wing (RAW) of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• Parag Jain, a 1989-batch IPS officer of the Punjab cadre, was appointed as RAW Chief on 1st July 2025

• He succeeded Ravi Sinha, whose tenure ended on 30th June 2025

• His appointment was approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet for a fixed two-year term

• RAW is India’s external intelligence agency, functioning under the Cabinet Secretariat, headquartered in New Delhi

• The agency was formally established in 1968

question: Who is serving as the Governor of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) as of July 2025?
solution:
• Sanjay Malhotra was appointed as the 26th Governor of RBI on 11th December 2024

• He succeeded Shaktikanta Das, whose tenure ended on 10th December 2024

• RBI is India’s central bank, responsible for monetary policy, currency issuance, banking regulation, and foreign exchange management

• It was established on 1st April 1935 under the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934, based on the Hilton Young Commission recommendations

• Initially a privately owned bank, RBI was nationalised on 1st January 1949 through the Reserve Bank of India (Transfer to Public Ownership) Act, 1948

• The first Governor of RBI was Sir Osborne Smith, who served from 1st April 1935 to 30th June 1937

• RBI is often called the “Bank of Banks” because it maintains current accounts of all scheduled banks, facilitates inter-bank transactions, and acts as the lender of last resort

• It functions under the Ministry of Finance, with its headquarters in Mumbai, popularly known as Mint Street

question: Who is serving as the Chairman of the State Bank of India (SBI) as of July 2025?
solution:
• Challa Sreenivasulu Setty was appointed as the 27th Chairman of SBI on 28th August 2024, succeeding Dinesh Kumar Khara

• SBI is India’s largest public sector bank, established on 1st July 1955 under the SBI Act, 1955, by nationalising the Imperial Bank of India

• The first Chairman of SBI was John Mathai, who served from 1955 to 1957

• SBI operates under the Ministry of Finance, with its headquarters in Mumbai

• It is often referred to as the “Banker to Every Indian” due to its extensive reach and role in financial inclusion

question: Who is serving as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) as of July 2025?
solution:
• Bhuvnesh Kumar, a 1995-batch IAS officer of the Uttar Pradesh cadre, was appointed as CEO of UIDAI on 1st January 2025

• UIDAI is a statutory authority under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), headquartered in New Delhi

• It was established in 2009 and became a statutory body in 2016 under the Aadhaar Act, 2016

• UIDAI issues Aadhaar, a 12-digit unique identity number to residents of India

• The first Chairman of UIDAI was Nandan Nilekani, appointed in 2009

question: Who is serving as the Chairman of the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) as of July 2025?

• UIDAI is a statutory authority under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY)

• It was established in 2009 and became a statutory body in 2016 under the Aadhaar Act, 2016

• UIDAI issues Aadhaar, a 12-digit unique identity number to residents of India

question: Who is serving as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Sansad TV as of July 2025?

• Sansad TV is a government-owned channel that broadcasts proceedings of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha, and public affairs programming

• It was launched on 15th September 2021 after merging Lok Sabha TV and Rajya Sabha TV

question: Who is the current Director General of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) of India as of July 2025?

• He succeeded Anish Dayal Singh, whose tenure ended on 31st December 2024

• His tenure is valid till 30th November 2027, or until further orders

question: Who is the current Director General of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) of India as of July 2025?

• It was established in October 1962, and functions under the Ministry of Home Affairs, headquartered in New Delhi

question: Who is the current Director General of the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) of India as of July 2025?

• His tenure is valid till 31st August 2025, or until further orders

• SSB is a central armed police force responsible for guarding India’s borders with Nepal and Bhutan

question: Who is the current Chairman of NITI Aayog of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• The Planning Commission was replaced by NITI Aayog on 1st January 2015, following Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s announcement on 15th August 2014

• NITI Aayog stands for National Institution for Transforming India, serving as the policy think tank of the Government of India

• The Chairman of NITI Aayog is the Prime Minister of India, hence Narendra Modi holds the position as of July 2025

• It is a non-constitutional, non-statutory body, created by executive resolution, not by an Act of Parliament

• It functions under the Ministry of Planning, headquartered in New Delhi

question: Who is the current Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of NITI Aayog of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• B.V.R. Subrahmanyam, a 1987-batch IAS officer of the Chhattisgarh cadre, was appointed as CEO of NITI Aayog on 25th February 2023

• His tenure was extended by one year in February 2025, now valid till February 2026

• As CEO, he oversees executive operations, policy implementation, and strategic coordination across ministries

• He succeeded Parameswaran Iyer, and previously served as Commerce Secretary and in the Prime Minister’s Office

question: Who is the current Vice Chairman of NITI Aayog of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• Suman Kumar Bery, a renowned economist and policy expert, assumed charge as Vice Chairman of NITI Aayog on 1st May 2022, succeeding Rajiv Kumar

• He holds the rank of Cabinet Minister and leads the strategic policy direction of the institution

• His background includes roles at Royal Dutch Shell, NCAER, and the World Bank, with expertise in economic reform, energy policy, and financial systems

question: Who is the current Chairman of the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• KC Venugopal, a senior Congress leader and Lok Sabha MP from Alappuzha, was re-appointed as Chairman of PAC on 1st May 2025

• He had previously taken charge in August 2024, succeeding Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, who held the post for five years

• The Public Accounts Committee (PAC) is the oldest and most prestigious financial committee of Parliament, constituted annually to examine government expenditure and audit reports of the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) of India

• PAC consists of 22 members — 15 from Lok Sabha and 7 from Rajya Sabha, elected by proportional representation

• By convention since 1967, the Chairman of PAC is a senior MP from the principal opposition party in Lok Sabha

• Past chairpersons include Atal Bihari Vajpayee, PV Narasimha Rao, and Murli Manohar Joshi

question: Who is the current Chairman of the Estimates Committee of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• Dr. Sanjay Jaiswal, BJP MP from Paschim Champaran, was appointed as the Chairman of the Estimates Committee on 1st May 2025 by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla

• The Estimates Committee is a 30-member financial committee of the Lok Sabha, reconstituted annually to examine government expenditure and suggest improvements in efficiency and economy

• It was first constituted in 1950, and functions under Rule 310 of the Rules of Procedure and Conduct of Business in Lok Sabha

• The committee scrutinizes budget estimates, recommends administrative reforms, and evaluates whether public funds are being used effectively

• Ministers cannot be members of the committee, and if a member is appointed as a minister, they cease to be part of it

• The committee’s term is one year, ending on 30th April 2026 for the current cycle

question: Who is the current Chairman of the Committee on Public Undertakings of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• Baijayant Panda, BJP MP from Kendrapara, was reappointed as Chairman of the Committee on Public Undertakings on 1st May 2025 for the term 2025–26, ending on 30th April 2026

• The committee comprises 22 members — 15 from Lok Sabha and 7 from Rajya Sabha, elected annually by proportional representation

• It examines the reports and accounts of public sector undertakings (PSUs) and ensures accountability in government-owned enterprises

• The committee plays a vital role in parliamentary financial oversight, alongside the Public Accounts Committee and Estimates Committee

question: Who is the current Speaker of the Lok Sabha of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• Om Birla, BJP MP from Kota-Bundi (Rajasthan), was elected as the Speaker of the 17th Lok Sabha on 19th June 2019

• He succeeded Sumitra Mahajan, who served during the 16th Lok Sabha

• The Speaker presides over Lok Sabha proceedings, maintains order, and heads various parliamentary committees

• The role is defined under Article 93 of the Indian Constitution, and the Speaker’s term typically aligns with the tenure of the Lok Sabha, unless a successor is elected earlier

• Even after the 17th Lok Sabha concluded in June 2024, Om Birla continues to serve as Speaker until the 18th Lok Sabha elects a new one

question: Who is the current Pro-tem Speaker of the Lok Sabha of India as of July 2025?
solution:
• Bhartruhari Mahtab, a seven-term Lok Sabha MP from Cuttack (Odisha), was appointed as the Pro-tem Speaker of the 18th Lok Sabha on 20th June 2024 by President Droupadi Murmu under Article 95(1) of the Constitution

• His role was to administer the oath to newly elected MPs and preside over the House until the election of the new Speaker

• He was assisted by a panel of senior MPs including Kodikunnil Suresh, T.R. Baalu, Radha Mohan Singh, Faggan Singh Kulaste, and Sudip Bandyopadhyay

• The Pro-tem Speaker is a temporary position, traditionally given to one of the senior-most members of the House

• The 18th Lok Sabha’s first session began on 24th June 2024, and the Speaker election was held on 26th June 2024

question: Siddhartha Mohanty is the Chairperson of which organisation as of July 2025?

• LIC, founded in 1956, is India’s largest life insurer, functioning under the Ministry of Finance, headquartered in Mumbai

• Mohanty is a 1985 batch Direct Recruit Officer, and previously served as CEO of LIC Housing Finance, COO, and Executive Director (Legal)

question: Sindhu Gangadharan is the Chairperson of which organisation as of July 2025?
solution:

• She is the first woman to lead both SAP Labs India and NASSCOM, India’s apex body for the IT and software services industry

• Her leadership focuses on AI adoption, digital transformation, and positioning India as a global tech hub

• She also serves on the boards of Siemens India, Titan Company, and is part of the Indo-German Chamber of Commerce Steering Committee

• NASSCOM (National Association of Software and Service Companies) was established in 1988, headquartered in New Delhi, and operates under the Ministry of Electronics and IT

question: Who is the current President of the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII), Pune as of July 2025?
solution:

• As President, Madhavan oversees the academic council, finance committee, and strategic collaborations — including the MoU with MFSCDCL to expand media training across Maharashtra

question: Dhirendra K Ojha is the head of which organisation as of July 2025?
option_1: Central Bureau of Communications
solution:

• Ojha also holds the position of Principal Spokesperson of the Government of India, coordinating media strategy and public communication across ministries

• Prior to this, he served as Director General of the Central Bureau of Communications (CBC), gaining expertise in government advertising and media outreach

• PIB, established in 1919, is the nodal agency for disseminating information on government policies, programs, and achievements, headquartered in New Delhi

question: Shri Dharam Veer Meena is the General Manager of which Indian Railway zone as of July 2025?
solution:
• Shri Dharam Veer Meena, an officer of the Indian Railways Service of Signal Engineers (IRSSE) from the 1988 batch, assumed charge as General Manager of Central Railway on 1st September 2024

• He previously served as Principal Chief Signal & Telecommunication Engineer (PCSTE) of Central Railway, where he completed 88 signalling installations in just 126 days, including major upgrades at CSMT

• Under his leadership, Central Railway became the first zone to invite tenders for full-network implementation of the KAVACH safety system, a major milestone in railway modernization

• In July 2025, he also took on additional charge as GM of Western Railway, reflecting his strategic importance across zones

• His tenure is marked by record progress in multitracking, safety works, and passenger amenities, positioning Central Railway as a leader in infrastructure transformation

question: Satish Kumar is the Chairperson & CEO of which organisation as of July 2025?
option_1: Airports Authority of India
option_4: Ministry of Civil Aviation
solution:

• His appointment was approved by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) and includes a contractual extension till 31st August 2025, post-superannuation

question: Jaya Verma Sinha is the first female Chairperson & CEO of which organisation?
solution:

question: Paramesh Sivamani is the Director General of which organisation as of July 2025?
option_4: National Disaster Response Force

• Sivamani is a specialist in Navigation and Direction, and has commanded major vessels like ICGS Samar and ICGS Vishwast

• Under his leadership, the ICG has conducted high-impact operations including anti-smuggling, cyclone rescue missions, and joint exercises with foreign coast guards

question: T.V. Narendran is the MD & CEO of which organisation as of July 2025?
solution:

• He also serves as Chairman of Tata Steel Europe and was elected Chair of the World Steel Association for 2024–25, becoming the second Indian to hold that post

Tata Steel Background:

• Founded by Jamsetji Nusserwanji Tata in 1907 as Tata Iron and Steel Company (TISCO)

• The first plant was set up in Sakchi, which was later renamed Jamshedpur, in present-day Jharkhand

• It was Asia’s first integrated private sector steel company, and a symbol of Indian industrial self-reliance

question: Parminder Chopra is the Chairperson & Managing Director (CMD) of which organisation as of July 2025?
solution:

• She has 35+ years of experience in the power and finance sectors, including roles at NHPC and Power Grid Corporation

• Under her leadership, PFC achieved record net profits, lowest NPAs, and became India’s largest renewable energy financier

question: Justice Prakash Srivastava is the Chairman of which organisation as of July 2025?
option_1: Law Commission of India
option_3: Central Pollution Control Board
option_4: Supreme Court Legal Services Committee
solution:

• He succeeded Justice Adarsh Kumar Goel, with Justice Sheo Kumar Singh serving as Acting Chairperson in the interim

• Srivastava enrolled as an advocate in 1987, and served as a judge in Madhya Pradesh High Court before becoming Chief Justice of Calcutta HC

• The NGT, established under the National Green Tribunal Act, 2010, is a quasi-judicial body for resolving environmental disputes efficiently

• Headquartered in New Delhi, NGT has zonal benches in Bhopal, Pune, Kolkata, Chennai, and Guwahati

question: Ajay Banga is the President of which international organisation as of July 2025?
option_3: United Nations Development Programme
solution:
• Ajay Banga began his five-year term as President of the World Bank Group on 2 June 2023

• He is the 14th President of the institution, succeeding David Malpass

• His leadership focuses on poverty reduction, climate action, and private-sector driven development

• Previously served as CEO of Mastercard and Vice Chairman at General Atlantic

• Awarded the Padma Shri (2016) and known for promoting financial inclusion globally

World Bank:

The World Bank Group was founded in 1944 during the Bretton Woods Conference, and began operations in 1946

• Its original name was the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), aimed at rebuilding war-torn nations after World War II

• Over time, its mission evolved to focus on poverty reduction, economic development, and shared prosperity in low- and middle-income countries

• It provides loans, grants, and technical assistance for infrastructure, education, health, climate action, and governance reforms

• The World Bank Group consists of five institutions: IBRD, IDA, IFC, MIGA, and ICSID, each supporting development in different ways

question: Who is the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of Tesla India as of July 2025?
solution:

• He joined Tesla in 2017 after its acquisition of SolarCity, and previously held roles as Chief Accounting Officer and Corporate Controller

• A Chartered Accountant from India and alumnus of Delhi University, he has over 17 years of experience at PwC before joining Tesla

• In July 2025, he was also appointed Treasurer of Elon Musk’s America Party, reflecting his growing influence beyond corporate finance
